title: 'I fear encounter': On the run, AAP MLA posts video from unknown location
content: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.

title: 'I was very troubled by her': Man shoots wife dead in busy market in Gorakhpur
content: In Gorakhpur, Vishwakarma Chauhan fatally shot his wife, Mamta, in a public market on Jail Road. The incident occurred after an argument outside a photo studio where Mamta had gone.

title: NIRF Rankings 2025 out: IIT Madras retains top spot; check full list
content: The Education Ministry has announced the National Institutional Ranking Framework 2025. The Indian Institute of Technology Madras secured the top rank. This is the tenth edition of the rankings. The rankings include categories like Engineering, Management, and Medicine. A new Sustainable Development Goals category is introduced. IIT Madras has consistently topped the rankings since 2016.

title: GST revamp: Kharge hits out at centre with ‘one nation, 9 taxes’ jibe
content: Congress has criticized the Centre's GST celebrations, alleging the tax system has become overly complex with multiple slabs, contrary to the original vision. The party highlighted its past advocacy for a simplified GST 2.0, accusing the government of belatedly adopting their suggestions for rate cuts and rationalization. The recent GST Council meeting introduced a two-tier structure, marking a significant revamp.

title: Magic of Bumrah: In a world of Messi vs Ronaldo, he is the Ibrahimovic - an outlier
content: Jasprit Bumrah thrives on challenges. He is a non-conformist. He has always chosen the unconventional route. While most athletes are swayed by the Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, his inspiration comes from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, a monster in his own right. During Covid-19, in an Instagram Live with Rohit Sharma, Bumrah had said: "I love Ibra. I can relate to his story that people did not take him seriously and then he became a star. I can relate as I think people took me lightly initially and then I proved them wrong, I am still trying."

title: Trump tariffs on digital taxes? Meta CEO raises concerns; semiconductors at risk
content: Donald Trump has threatened tariffs on nations imposing digital taxes, following concerns raised by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg about European regulatory overreach. Trump, who once called Zuckerberg a 'criminal,' seems to have mended fences, evident from recent White House meetings and Meta's support for Trump's inauguration.

title: Dream11 effect: India jerseys being sold at 80% discount; here's how much they cost
content: Indian cricket team's jersey manufacturer Adidas is offering massive discounts, up to 80%, on Indian cricket team jerseys, bringing the price down to as much as Rs 1,199. This follows Dream11's early exit as the team's sponsor due to new online gaming regulations.

title: GST rate cuts a booster shot! What do tax changes mean for stock markets? Explained
content: The Modi government's GST rate cuts are injecting vitality into the Indian economy, potentially offsetting US tariffs. Nirmala Sitharaman's reforms, impacting various sectors, sparked a Sensex surge. Analysts predict increased consumption, benefiting auto, FMCG, and cement industries.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The Goods and Services Tax Council approved new GST reforms. The council reduced the slabs to 5% and 18%. Nirmala Sitharaman announced the changes. The revised rates take effect from September 22. Consumer electronics like ACs and TVs will see a price cut. Mobile phone and laptop GST rates remain unchanged. Air conditioners and dishwashers will also become cheaper.

title: GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper
content: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.

title: US Open: Yuki Bhambri one step closer to 'dream' final
content: Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus have advanced to the US Open 2025 men's doubles semifinals, defeating Nikola Mektic and Rajeev Ram. Bhambri, India's top-ranked doubles player, achieves his first Grand Slam semifinal. He aims to be the first Indian champion at the US Open since 2015, while other Indian pairs faced early exits.

title: ‘A bet on myself’: Youngest female billionaire on why she left college early
content: Lucy Guo, Forbes' youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her entrepreneurial drive to her frugal upbringing. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's early hustles, from playground trading to selling virtual items and creating internet tools, laid the foundation for her success in the tech world.

title: Another earthquake in Afghanistan: 4.8 magnitude jolts region
content: Afghanistan has been struck by two earthquakes, a 4.8-magnitude tremor following a 4.3-magnitude quake, exacerbating an already dire situation. The quakes, coupled with flash floods and harsh weather, have devastated communities, particularly in Kunar and Nangarhar provinces, where over 1400 lives were lost.

title: 'Behaving like Pomeranian': BJP MLA compares woman cop to dog
content: BJP MLA BP Harish faces legal trouble after allegedly comparing Davanagere SP Uma Prashanth to a 'pomeranian dog' during a press conference. He accused the IPS officer of disrespecting him while favoring the Shamanuru family.

title: AI Express flight cancelled after bird strike in Vijayawada; 2nd incident in 48 hours
content: An Air India Express flight from Vijayawada to Bengaluru was cancelled on Thursday due to a bird strike during taxiing. An eagle hit the plane's nose, prompting alternate arrangements for passengers. This incident follows a similar event on Tuesday, where an IndiGo flight from Nagpur to Kolkata returned to Nagpur after a suspected bird strike shortly after take-off for inspection.

title: This actress started her career at the age of five; had two kids out of wedlock
content: Sarika's early life was marked by abandonment and child acting. She left home at 21. Sarika met Kamal Haasan amidst social pressures. Their relationship faced backlash. They had two daughters, Shruti and Akshara, out of wedlock. Securing housing was difficult. The couple eventually married but later divorced in 2004. Sarika also fought a legal battle over her mother's flat.

title: 37 dead in Punjab floods: 3.55 lakh people impacted
content: Punjab declares itself a disaster-affected area as flood-related fatalities climb to 37, with seven new deaths reported on Wednesday. Among the victims were an elderly couple in Barnala district, killed when their house collapsed. The floods, impacting over 1,655 villages across 23 districts, have affected 3.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
content: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Chhattisgarh reservoir collapse: 4 dead, 3 missing as flash flood hits Balrampur
content: In Chhattisgarh's Balrampur district, a tragic incident occurred as an old reservoir collapsed in Dhaneshpur village, resulting in four fatalities and at least three individuals missing. Eight members of a family were swept away when the Luti reservoir breached, destroying their home. Rescue operations are ongoing near the Kanhar river to locate the missing, including two children.

title: 'It may be… possible to live to 150 yrs old’: Mic captures Xi, Putin's candid chat
content: During a visit to Beijing, Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin discussed biotechnology and the potential for extended lifespans, even speculating about living to 150. This conversation, occurring before a military parade, highlighted their personal interest in longevity research and coincided with their efforts to extend political power. Putin also advocated for a multipolar world, denouncing a unipolar global order.

title: Bihar jail turns into a wedding venue for rape accused, survivor
content: In a rare turn of events, a jail in Madhubani, Bihar, became the venue for a wedding between an inmate and his widowed sister-in-law. The accused, facing charges of sexual exploitation, married the woman following a Patna High Court directive. The court granted bail on the condition that the marriage be verified.

title: Watch: Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano erupts again; crowd gathers to witness molten lava
content: Kilauea volcano in Hawaii has erupted again, marking its 32nd eruption since December, delighting tourists and residents. The lava remains contained within the summit crater, posing no threat to populated areas. Scientists are closely monitoring the eruption, which features spectacular lava fountains, while advising visitors to stay safe and informed due to potential hazards.

title: End war via talks or I will end it by force: Putin tells Ukraine
content: President Putin stated in China that negotiations could end the Ukraine war "if common sense prevails," an option he prefers, but he's prepared to use force if necessary. He sees potential progress due to the US administration's efforts to find a settlement.

title: 'Countless memories': Amit Mishra retires from all forms of cricket
content: Veteran Indian leg-spinner Amit Mishra has retired from professional cricket. His career spanned over 25 years. Recurring injuries and a desire to promote younger players led to this decision. Mishra is grateful to the BCCI, Haryana cricket association, his colleagues, and family. He also thanks his fans for their support.

title: TV actor Ashish Kapoor arrested in Delhi 'gang-rape' case
content: A TV actor has been apprehended in Pune concerning an alleged rape that occurred at a house party in Delhi's Civil Lines this past August. The 24-year-old victim reported being drugged and gang-raped by a group, who also filmed the assault and threatened to release the footage online if she reported the incident.

title: Online betting app case: ED summons former cricketer Shikhar Dhawan
content: Shikhar Dhawan has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in connection with an ongoing investigation into an online betting app suspected of money laundering. This action follows similar summons issued to other celebrities, including Suresh Raina and Rana Daggubati, as part of a broader crackdown on illegal betting platforms and their promoters.

title: ‘Something going to happen’: Donald Trump fuels buzz on Russia-Ukraine war
content: Amidst escalating tensions and recent Russian strikes on Kyiv, former US President Trump has reiterated his commitment to brokering peace between Russia and Ukraine. Trump claims to have discussed the matter with Presidents Putin and Zelenskyy, expressing optimism about achieving a resolution.

title: Yamuna threatens Delhi: From Signature Bridge to Rajghat, fresh advisories issued
content: Rising Yamuna water levels caused significant traffic disruptions in Delhi, leading to road closures and diversions. Key stretches like Outer Ring Road were affected, with advisories issued for commuters to avoid inundated routes. While the Majnu Ka Tila stretch gradually reopened, congestion persisted on arterial roads, and restrictions may continue depending on the river's water levels.

title: From paneer to paratha, Centre explains tweaks in GST rates
content: The GST Council has approved significant rate cuts across various sectors, effective September 22nd, providing relief to consumers and farmers. Daily-use items like hair oil, shampoo, and toothpaste will now attract a reduced 5% GST, while health and life insurance are entirely exempt.

title: 'Pushed Modi closer to Russia, China': Ex-Trump aide slams 50% India tariffs
content: Former US National Security Advisor John Bolton criticized Donald Trump's trade policies, asserting they've damaged US-India relations. Bolton claims Trump's tariffs, particularly the 50% imposition on India, have driven Prime Minister Modi closer to Russia and China.

title: 'Maybe': NFL commissioner on Taylor Swift performing at Super Bowl
content: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell hinted at the possibility of Taylor Swift performing at the Super Bowl, fueled by her recent engagement to Travis Kelce. While noncommittal, Goodell mentioned awaiting input from Jay-Z, whose Roc Nation has been producing the halftime show. The Chiefs aim to return to the Super Bowl, adding to the season's excitement.

title: Monsoon toll mounts to 500 in Himachal Pradesh, J&K, Punjab, Haryana
content: Relentless monsoon rains have triggered devastating floods and landslides across Himachal Pradesh, J&K, Punjab, and Haryana, resulting in at least 500 deaths. Thousands are stranded as highways are blocked, rivers surge above danger levels, and crops are flattened. Punjab has declared a state of disaster, while rescue efforts continue amidst widespread destruction and infrastructure damage.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Rate at new highs - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are trending upwards, potentially reaching ₹107,800, supported by global uncertainties. Silver also shows a positive bias, aiming for ₹130,000 due to industrial demand and safe-haven appeal.

title: Happy Teachers Day 2025: 110+ wishes, quotes, images, messages & status to share
content: Teachers' Day in India honors Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, celebrating teachers' vital role in shaping lives. Students express gratitude for their mentors' guidance and dedication. In 2025, individuals can use heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to appreciate teachers' profound impact on their academic and personal growth, acknowledging their invaluable contributions.

title: 'Regret voting for him': Trump supporter's British wife faces deportation
content: A British woman, Donna Hughes-Brown, faces deportation after being detained at Chicago’s O’Hare, despite living legally in the US for over three decades. Her husband, a former Trump supporter, regrets his vote, blaming the administration's immigration policies. Hughes-Brown, a green card holder for 37 years, was detained due to a misdemeanor from 2015, which her husband claims was resolved.

title: James Webb Telescope: Ghostly dust rings revealed; 'dead' star surprises astronomers
content: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured unprecedented images of the planetary nebula NGC 1514, revealing infrared-bright rings around a dying binary star system. These detailed observations, made with the Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI), expose the nebula's complex 4,000-year history and unique thermal dust emission. The findings challenge existing theories about stellar evolution and highlight the intricate interactions within binary systems.

title: Trump snaps at Putin question: US prez blasts reporter; cites 'India' to justify stance
content: President Trump defended his administration's actions against Russia, citing secondary sanctions on India as a significant measure costing Russia "hundreds of billions of dollars." He rebuked a Polish reporter questioning the lack of punitive actions against Putin, highlighting India's oil purchases and hinting at further sanctions. Trump also suggested the reporter should seek new employment due to their perceived lack of understanding.

title: GST rate cuts bonanza! What is cheaper and dearer? Check full list of items
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts, effective September 22, bringing relief to the common man. Daily use items like hair oil, soaps, and toothpaste now fall under the 5% tax bracket. Several items, including ultra-high temperature milk and paneer, face zero tax. Air conditioners, TVs, and small cars are now taxed at 18%.

title: Delhi floods: Yamuna swallows homes inch by inch
content: Torrential floods, triggered by a drain breach near the Delhi-Haryana border, submerged Jharoda Kalan and parts of Gitanjali Colony, displacing thousands. Mungeshpur was particularly affected, with residents forced to flee their homes as water levels rose rapidly. Rescue operations were initiated, and a municipal school was converted into a relief camp.

title: Canada rejects 62% of student visas in 2025, toughest stance in a decade
content: Canada’s student visa rejection rate has hit a decade high of 62% in 2025, with Indian applicants facing up to 80% refusals. Stricter financial proof, tougher documentation checks, and new post-study work permit rules are reshaping Canada’s stance on international education. The clampdown leaves students, families, and universities bearing the brunt of Ottawa’s tighter immigration policies.

title: Indian on world trip slams UK police after bike theft, says he misses Mumbai Police
content: An Indian blogger, Yogesh Alekari, on a global motorbike tour, criticized British police after his bike was stolen in Nottingham. The theft occurred in a paid parking area at Wollaton Park, with his passport and belongings onboard.

title: Watching IPL, cricket gets costlier: How GST rate changes impacts sports
content: Cricket enthusiasts will face steeper prices for IPL tickets as the government has increased GST rates from 28% to 40%, categorising IPL viewing as a luxury activity alongside casinos. This significant hike means a Rs 1,000 ticket now costs Rs 1,400, up from Rs 1,280, impacting fans across India.

title: US immigrant students priced out as states end tuition support
content: Thousands of immigrant students across the US are being forced to delay or abandon university as several states revoke access to in-state tuition. The change, driven by shifting immigration policies under President Trump, has led to increased education costs and limited opportunities for students without legal status. Many are turning to online study or entering low-wage work. Legal challenges and federal investigations are also targeting institutions offering tuition support to undocumented students.

title: What are ‘sin goods’ and why do they now attract the highest GST rate?
content: India’s new GST framework introduces a 40% tax slab on “sin goods” and luxury items, consolidating the earlier 28% rate plus cess into a single levy effective September 22, 2025.

title: Elderly man pushed to death in Bengaluru road rage incident
content: The 61-year-old victim Syed Nisar Ahmed, suffering from paralysis and breathing issues, had come to the hospital in a car with his son and son-in-law for consultation.

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah inaugurates Phase-II of K. C. Valley project for filling 30 lakes in Kolar taluk of Karnataka
content: The second phase of the K.C. Valley project would be completed at a cost of ₹446 crore by December 2025

title: India's infant mortality rate touches low of 25, down from 40 in 2013
content: Madhya Pradesh, Chattisgarh, and Uttar Pradesh reported the highest levels of IMR in the country at 37; the lowest was Manipur at 3

title: ‘We will be left with no forests’, SC on floods, illegally felled Himalayan trees flowing in swollen rivers
content: The court on Thursday voiced a deep anguish about floods in the States of Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab

title: SC grants bail to 23-year-old influencer in rape case, says charges false
content: In scathing comments, the Bench had also asked how Delhi Police could file a rape case against the social media influencer, when the woman had gone voluntarily with him.

title: ‘Waits like a dog’: FIR against Karnataka BJP MLA B.P. Harish for derogatory remarks against Davanagere SP
content: K.T.J. Nagar Police in Davanagere have registered an FIR against the MLA based on a complaint by Superintendent of Police Uma Prashanth

title: FIR against ex-Jharkhand Minister for ‘slapping’ bodyguards, hurling ‘casteist abuses’
content: A case has been lodged under sections of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989, police said.

title: Thiru Onam eve shopping fervour, Uthrada Pachil, peaks in Kerala on Thursday
content: Brisk sales in markets, malls and textile shops; prices of groceries remain low, but coconut oil stays high

title: T.N. Police submit before Madras High Court video of Ponmudy’s speech
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar decides to go through the speech and then take a call on the issue on September 16, 2025

title: Shikhar Dhawan appears before ED in illegal betting app case
content: The agency recorded his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) as part of this investigation linked to an “illegal” betting app named 1xBet

title: Terror funding case: Supreme Court notice to NIA on Kashmiri separatist leader Shabir Shah's plea for bail
content: The Bench issued notice to the NIA on Shah's plea challenging a June 12 this year order of the High Court. The Bench posted the matter for hearing after two weeks.

title: Tamil Nadu hotels to boycott U.S.-based beverages over Trump’s tariffs
content: Tamil Nadu Hotel Owners Association said it may also log out of food delivery apps, such as Swiggy and Zomato, and instead migrate to a home-grown app

title: Gujarat government to soon table 'Jan Vishwas Bill' to decriminalise minor offences
content: It is also aimed at simplifying rules and regulations and reducing burden on courts, says State Parliamentary and Legislative Affairs Minister Rushikesh Patel

title: Renovated emergency medical care block in Basaveshwar hospital in Kalaburagi to be inaugurated on September 5
content: The modernisation initiative is aimed at significantly improving patient care, operational efficiency and emergency preparedness at the institute

title: DC inspects rain-hit areas in Kalaburagi district of Karnataka
content: She also inspected the water purification plant on Jewargi Road in Shahabad town, and directed officials to ensure supply of safe drinking water

title: GST Council meeting LIVE: FMCG, consumer durables, cement stocks rally on GST reforms
content: Automobile sector stocks up at 11-month high, insurance stocks in limelight; FMCG sector industry players say GST rate cut to spur domestic demand, help build long-term growth

title: What began as classifieds, Locanto and Skokka are now hotspots for organised prostitution, cyber frauds
content: Investigators say fraudsters exploit technical loopholes and international servers to stay ahead of enforcement

title: India rains LIVE: Yamuna crosses danger mark in Delhi; Severe floods claim 37 lives in Punjab, State government confirms
content: In Punjab, Governor Gulab Chand Kataria submitted a detailed report on the flood situation to Union Agriculture and Farmers Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan

title: Should reservations exceed the 50% cap? | Explained
content: What do Articles 15 and 16 of the Constitution guarantee? How are formal and substantive equality different? Are reservations an exception to the idea of equality of opportunity or a continuation? Are reservation benefits concentrated within specific sub-castes in OBCs, SCs and STs?

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls for strengthening the local bodies financially
content: Suggesting the local bodies to pursue revenue-generation opportunities, while ensuring accountability in fund utilisation, the Chief Minister asks officials to identify the local bodies with low per capita income so that targeted support can be extended to them

title: Chandrababu Naidu pushes for more homestays, tent houses to boost tourism in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Chief Minister calls for the participation of NRIs to achieve targets of creating 10,000 new hotel rooms by March 2026 and 50,000 rooms by 2029

title: Sewage treatment plant proposed to address wastewater flowing through Coimbatore International Airport
content: The untreated sewage has led to foul odour spreading across the airport and nearby residential areas, a matter that has been repeatedly raised with civic officials.

title: Daily working hours allowed to go up from 9 to 10 hours in Maharashtra’s private sector as State cabinet plans to amend laws
content: The move is aimed at attracting investments, generating employment and safeguarding workers' rights, an official statement said

title: Chandrababu Naidu denounces YSRCP’s ‘fake campaign’ on fertilizer supply, warns of stern action
content: The State has 94,892 MT of urea available as on September 3 and that the Central government has allotted an additional 53,000 MT, which will reach in about 10 days, the Chief Minister asserts; he also advises farmers to keep away from politics

title: SIT files B Report in gang rape case against Munirathna
content: The investigation found no contact between the complainant and the MLA and found no evidence to substantiate the allegations made, leading the police to file a B report in the case

title: Dalit Subbiah: A revolutionary musician’s life celebrated in award-winning Tamil documentary at IDSFFK
content: A film about a seemingly docile revolutionary turns quickly into a the celebration of a superstar in Dalit Subbiah — Voice of the Rebels, the film that won the best long doc at IDSFFK

title: Fake SHGs siphoned off ₹56 crore during 2019-24, says 20-Point programme chief Lanka Dinakar
content: Stating that cases have been filed against those responsible, he says biometric authentication linked to Aadhaar has been introduced to prevent duplicate membership and fake groups

title: TCS Delivery Centre in Vizag likely to start operations in September
content: A deadline of September 20 has been set to complete all infrastructure and internal works at the TCS office in Rushikonda Hill, says official

title: Rajasthan Assembly passes Bill to regulate coaching centres amid Opposition’s protest
content: Congress MLAs protested against the introduction of the Bill with “watered down” provisions and said the BJP government was playing into the hands of coaching institutes

title: Kolkata’s oldest bookshop opens a free library at its historic College Street premises
content: Dasgupta and Co. has created a public library mainly with the intention of benefiting students who can’t afford books; an online library is also on the anvil

title: U.S. firm Jaggaer opens GCC in Hyderabad, plans to ramp hiring
content: The facility has 180 employees and there are plans to raise the headcount to 500 in coming years, the firm said

title: Rift among Indian scientists as International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics bans Israel from future editions
content: More than 500 academics petitioned to suspend Israel’s official participation in the International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics, prompting a backlash from 300 Indian scientists who urged the Prime Minister to take strict action

title: Consumer Commission orders private hospital to compensate woman for post C-section complications
content: The complainants contended that what happened to Naseemunnisa was on account of negligence in administering anaesthesia

title: Six family members get life imprisonment for murder in Odisha
content: “After nearly three years, Additional Sessions Judge Bishnu Prasad Mishra convicted Anant Pujari, Siba Shankar Pujari, Chandan Pujari, Dumar Pujari and Dalimba Pujari under Sections 302 and 149 IPC. A juvenile involved in the crime was tried separately and also sentenced to life imprisonment,” said Santosh Mishra, Additional Public Prosecutor

title: Apex Manipur Naga body announces trade embargo from September 8
content: The restriction on trade and transportation of goods follows the Centre’s “indifference” to pleas against scrapping the Free Movement Regime and fencing the India-Myanmar border

title: Small cars, bikes up to 350 cc to get cheaper as GST reforms kick in
content: Almost one-third of the passenger vehicles industry will see price reduction of 8.5%; Revised GST slabs to spur demand, help in auto sales especially in the festive season

title: Reviving MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: The Centre, State, and local bodies must act now to restore this lifeline — ensuring that no worker is left behind

title: High coliform levels detected on four stretches of Periyar
content: The analysis of water samples was done as part of the CPCB’s National Water Quality Monitoring Programme

title: Infopark phase-3: GCDA to deploy dedicated team of officials for land-pooling
content: GCDA becomes first local body to act as ‘appropriate authority’; ‘300 acres to be identified based on various parameters’

title: UDF, BJP contest final voter’s list in Ernakulam
content: UDF leader alleges 142 voters from his ward were included in another; BJP claims delimitation and list preparation were faulty

title: Railway police in Ernakulam flag alarming trend of ‘hit and rob’ cases
content: Of the six major theft cases registered by the Ernakulam railway police in August, four pertained to offenders snatching mobile phones and other valuables after attacking those who travel by sitting on footboards of train

title: Notorious gangster deported from Cambodia, arrested by Haryana STF
content: Mainpal Badli, wanted in two dozen cases of murder, attempt to murder, dacoity and robbery, had jumped parole in 2018, and fled to Mauritius, then Indonesia before settling at Siem Reap in Cambodia.

title: Youth dies after pilot car in Trinamool Congress MLA’s hits motorbike
content: The Registration Certificate of the vehicle which met with the accident had expired a year ago raising questions as to how such a vehicle could be used for pilot car services.

title: Students cautioned against falling prey to drug menace
content: EAGLE emphasises need for prevention of crimes, says students will be made active part of the government’s fight against drugs, highlights parents’ role in guiding children in the right path

title: Search on for bike rider who sped past over rail platform
content: The youth reportedly rode a premium bike onto the second platform of the station and sped past the passengers

title: Police lathi-charge farmers waiting for fertilizer in Rewa as shortage problem worsens in Madhya Pradesh
content: The incident took place at Rewa’s Karahiya Mandi, where several farmers were waiting to collect tokens for fertlizer, with some alleging that they had been waiting for at least 48 hours and mismanagement on part of the administration

title: Bhutan’s PM Dasho Tshering Tobgay visits Nalanda University in Rajgir
content: He described Nalanda as a vast city of scholarship and spirituality, producing great masters and shaping Buddhist traditions that continue to flourish in Bhutan.

title: Paddy farmers to stage hunger strike in Kerala
content: Farmers under the banner of the Kole Protection Committee will stage a hunger strike at Changaramkulam near Edappal on Thursday.

title: COP-30 curtain raiser in Kolkata raises alarms for the Sundarbans delta’s severe erosion and rising sea levels
content: Activists and leaders call for global action and immediate technological and financial support to restore the ecologically sensitive delta

title: Maratha quota row: ‘Who are you to give Kunbi certificates,’ Bhujbal questions his own government
content: “This order will definitely affect the OBCs. I am in the process of taking legal consultation,” NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal said; he also warned of a mass protest

title: ₹398 crore flyover project to ease east-west traffic congestion in Mehdipatnam
content: The flyover project in the area comes exactly 20 years after the conceptualisation of the PVNR Expressway that was completed in 2009 under a Congress government

title: Amit Shah asks Tamil Nadu BJP leaders to desist from commenting on OPS, Dhinakaran
content: The core group was asked to identify Assembly seats where the BJP might contest in alliance with the AIADMK in 2026, although no number was provided

title: Flyers without mobility issues can pay for wheelchair: DGCA
content: Proposal part of draft norms placed for stakeholder consultations ahead of Bombay High Court hearing on September 25 after the court ordered an expert committee to examine the issue of wheelchair availability at airports

title: GST Council approves two-rate tax slab effective September 22
content: Govt retains 5% and 18% slabs; reforms carried out with focus on common man, says Finance Minister; products such as soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, bicycles may cost less with inclusion in 5% slab

title: T.N. restricts provision of ‘guard of honour’ for VIPs on official visit for State government functions
content: The decision is in line with the instructions of the President’s Secretariat, the Vice-President’s Secretariat and the Prime Minister’s Office. The State government would also decide if and when there are ‘exceptional occasions’. A Government Order was issued in this regard earlier this week

title: India, EFTA trade pact to come into force from October 1: Switzerland
content: Under the pact, India has received an investment commitment of $100 billion in 15 years from the grouping while allowing several products such as Swiss watches, chocolates and cut and polished diamonds at lower or zero duties

title: Internal reservation: Nomadic castes to continue indefinite stir
content: Federation for Social Justice for SCs seeks priority in reservation for 59 microscopic communities, including nomadic and semi-nomadic castes, which have been identified as the most backward castes among the SCs by the commission

title: Reservation roster faces criticism for ‘favouring general category’ in Karnataka
content: The new roster violates the guidelines and is against the roster announced in 2022, says Karnataka State SC/ST Government Employees Association president D. Chandrashekaraiah

title: BJP to hold meetings with partners on Bihar strategy
content: Discussions with NDA partners to be held in every Assembly seat over the next three weeks; Leaders to rally against offensive language aimed at PM’s mother

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran exits NDA even as Amit Shah seeks to mend relations
content: Mr. Dhinakaran reiterates the AMMK had unconditionally joined the NDA during the 2024 Parliamentary elections only to ensure Narendra Modi’s return as Prime Minister for the third time

title: Centre issues guidelines to co-locate 11 lakh anganwadis on nearest school premises
content: Co-location eases transition from pre-school to primary school, aids curriculum alignment, community participation; so far, 2.9 lakh anganwadis have been co-located or mapped with schools with Class 1

title: Assam Jatiya Parishad protests extension of CAA deadline
content: The AJP termed the extension of the deadline as the “biggest crime” ever committed against Assamese people, and accused the Bharatiya Janata Party-led government of perpetuating historical injustice

title: IDF shares call recording; accuses Hamas of using Gaza civilians as shields
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Watch: Passenger plugs cooler in train socket; meme fest follows
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Flood alert in J&K's Srinagar after Jhelum overflows in Budgam; evacuation advisory issued
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Flood Alert In Delhi, Yamuna Above Danger Mark, Relief Camps Submerged
content: Relief camps in low-lying areas of Delhi, including those near Mayur Vihar Phase-I, were inundated on Thursday as the Yamuna River swelled dangerously above the danger mark following incessant rainfall.

title: A Look Back At 1988 Floods As Punjab Faces Its Worst Deluge In Decades
content: The devastating floods have killed at least 37 people and left a trail of destruction in Punjab. Exacerbated by continuous heavy rains and the release of water from upstream dams, the floodwater submerged over 1.75 lakh acres of farmland

title: Woman Jumps Off Roof After Husband's Dare. Family Says In-Laws Wanted Dowry
content: A woman has been hospitalised in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh after she jumped from the terrace of her two-storey home following an altercation with her husband

title: GST Revamp: What's Cheaper, Costlier? See Full List Here
content: New GST Slabs: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council on Wednesday approved a complete overhaul of India's tax consumption tax since its launch in 2017.

title: "There Is No Secret": Putin On His Conversation With PM Modi During Limo Ride
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was briefed by Russian President Vladimir Putin on the latter's talks with US President Donald Trump during the Alaska summit, earlier this week.

title: From Dining Out To Luxury Flights, Here's How Much You'll Save Or Spend
content: Planning a dinner out, a quick vacation, or even just stocking up your kitchen? The new GST rules change how you pay. While your restaurant bill and grocery basket are set to shrink, flying business class or owning a yacht will get expensive.

title: GST On Bidis Drop To 18% But Cigarettes And Gutkha Rises To 40%. Here's Why
content: While prices of cigarettes and other tobacco products, such as Gutkha, are set to rise after the GST reforms announced yesterday, the humble bidi will see a marginal drop in prices

title: Analysis: Trump Sours India Ties As China Deal Occupies Top Priority
content: Images this week of PM Modi holding hands with Russia's Vladimir Putin at a summit hosted by China's Xi Jinping seemed to confirm what many experts have already concluded - the US has stumbled in its effort to draw India into its diplomatic orbit.

title: Eric Trump's $548 Million Crypto Stake Is Worth More Than Trump's Golf Empire
content: Eric Trump's stake in a crypto company created this year is now worth about $548 million, in one of the most striking examples of how the first family is profiting from the digital-asset industry.

title: Apple Plans AI-Powered Web Search Tool To Rival OpenAI, Perplexity
content: Apple Inc. is planning to launch its own artificial intelligence-powered web search tool next year, stepping up competition with OpenAI and Perplexity AI Inc.

title: Rs 55 Crore Frozen, 5 Luxury Cars Seized In Online Betting Case Linked To Karnataka MLA
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has frozen assets worth Rs 55 crore in a major crackdown on an illegal online betting racket linked to Karnataka MLA KC Veerendra.

title: Trump Calls Musk '80% Genius, 20% Problems' While Predicting His Return To Republican Party
content: US President Donald Trump said former ally Elon Musk has no choice but to return to the Republican Party after their highly public rift earlier this year.

title: GST Rate Cuts To Spur Growth, Benefit First-Time Buyers: Auto Industry
content: The GST Council's decision to cut tax rates on various categories of automobiles is timely and will inject fresh momentum into the Indian automotive sector.

title: Vasundhara Raje's Closed-Door Meet With RSS Chief Sets Political Circles Abuzz
content: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje's closed-door meeting with Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat in Jodhpur has set political circles abuzz.

title: Popcorn Debate Laid To Rest? Here's What Your Next Bucket Will Cost
content: The long-running debate over how popcorn should be taxed under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) has finally been settled.

title: Donald Trump Asks US Supreme Court To Uphold His Global Tariffs
content: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to uphold his global tariffs, seeking review in a case that could affect trillions of dollars in trade and give him broad new leverage over the world economy.

title: Watch: Gurugram Man Lifts Scooter Over Head To Beat Traffic Jam
content: Incessant rains in Delhi-NCR have once again brought the area to a standstill, causing massive traffic jams

title: GST Reforms: FAQs On What Changes
content: The GST Council, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, held its 56th meeting on September 3 in New Delhi and announced changes in the rates. Here are all your questions answered.

title: What Are Sin Goods And Why They Attract The Highest GST Rate
content: The government has introduced a new 40% Goods and Services Tax (GST) slab, the highest in the regime, for "sin goods" and certain luxury items.

title: Instagram Launches iPad App With Reels At The Center, Aims to Challenge TikTok
content: Instagram launched a dedicated iPad application on Wednesday, placing its short-form video feature Reels at the center of the redesigned interface as parent company Meta intensifies competition with TikTok.
